body.p:
To his Excellency -- Beriah MaGoffin
Governor. of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Your petitioner John Perry Jr would respectfully represent that at the September term of the Jessamine Circuit Court 1859 he was indicted by the Grand Jury of Jessamine County for Betting on the election ($100 -- ) of Congressmen in the 8th Congressional District between Wm E Sims and J M Harlan which said money he lost, upon which Indictment a Bench warrant was issued Dec 8th. 1859 returnable to March Term 1860 of the Court aforesaid.

Your petitioner would represent that he is not in the habit of betting, he is a law abiding man that the bet was made under excitement, that since the bet and the Indictment he has connected himself with the church, and hopes and believes he will live a different life -- that this is his first offence and Indictment ever found against him, wherefore he would pray your Excellency to exercise the power wisely vested in you by the Constitution to release him from said Indictment and the fine thereunder and will ever pray &c
The undersigned citizens of Jessamine County would most earnestly and respectfully join in the prayer of the foregoing petition --

Wm H Daniel
J B Cook
Jno Metcalf
W Clarke
S. S.
A D McAfee
W. R. Wiler
M. T. Lowry clk J cc
Thos B, Crutcher
Geo. J. Campbell
S. Noland
P. M. Smith
W, Dickerson
John McCabe

John Perry --
Betting on elections --
no judgment --
